messages.message: Not a bid deal, but when I export the results of a batch run, the zip file has UTC timestamp. It would be better if we could use the user’s local timestamp.

the logic to change would be https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/aihub_23_04/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/api_server_apps/handler/api/v1/flow.py#L2006 and https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/aihub_23_04/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/api_server_apps/handler/api/v1/flow.py#L1925

changing this would also impact exports in Human Review, but i imagine that this would also be helpful in Human Review

Hmm, if this is done at the backend, then it’s always going to be the server’s timestamp.
The UI needs to send the timezone of the user in the API request (unless there’s already a way to extract that info from the request) #noob
